Types

progress_dialog

title STRING
comment STRING
vmin progress_dialog_value_type
vmax progress_dialog_value_type
vstp progress_dialog_value_type

canintr BOOLEAN

showtimefmt STRING

canceled BOOLEAN
ts_start DATETIME YEAR TO FRACTION
ts_last DATETIME YEAR TO FRACTION
ts_infinite DATETIME YEAR TO FRACTION
ts_disp_interval INTERVAL SECOND TO FRACTION
window ui.Window
form ui.Form
END RECORD

Methods

cancel

FUNCTION cancel()

Cancels the progress session.

Simulates a user interruption. Closing the progress dialog will not ask for user confirmation if configured.

close

FUNCTION close()

Terminates a progress session.

This method closes the progress dialog window. Progress dialog window can be re-opened with open()

free

FUNCTION free()

Finalizes the progress dialog object usage.

Progress dialog object can be re-initialized with initialize()

getComment

FUNCTION getComment() RETURNS STRING

Returns current progress comment.

getStep

FUNCTION getStep() RETURNS progress_dialog_value_type

Returns progress step value.

getValue

FUNCTION getValue() RETURNS progress_dialog_value_type

Returns current progress value.

getValueMax

FUNCTION getValueMax() RETURNS progress_dialog_value_type

Returns progress end value.

getValueMin

FUNCTION getValueMin() RETURNS progress_dialog_value_type

Returns progress start value.

initialize

FUNCTION initialize(title STRING, comment STRING, vmin progress_dialog_value_type, vmax progress_dialog_value_type, vstp progress_dialog_value_type)

Initializes a progress dialog object.

Parameters:
title - The title of the progress window.
comment - The comment to be displayed in the progress window.
vmin - The minimum value for the progress bar.
vmax - The maximum value for the progress bar.
vstp - The step value to be used by the step() method.

interrupted

FUNCTION interrupted() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Returns TRUE if the progress was interrupted by user (INT_FLAG==TRUE).

The method resets INT_FLAG to FALSE, so callers do not have to reset it.

isInfinite

FUNCTION isInfinite() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Returns TRUE if the progress is infinite.

open

FUNCTION open()

Opens the progress window.

progress

FUNCTION progress(value progress_dialog_value_type)

Sets the progress value and refreshes display.

Parameters:
value - The value to be set in the progressbar.

setComment

FUNCTION setComment(comment STRING)

Sets the comment without display refresh.

Parameters:
comment - The comment to be displayed in the progress window.

setExecTimeDisplayFormat

FUNCTION setExecTimeDisplayFormat(fmt STRING)

Sets the format to show the execution time at the end of the comment.

Parameters:
fmt - The util.Intervale.format() style format, like "%H:%M:%S"

setRefreshInterval

FUNCTION setRefreshInterval(itv INTERVAL SECOND TO FRACTION)

Defines the time interval to refresh the display.

The show(), progress() or step()/stepInfinite() methods may be called very often. To avoid to many network roundtrips with the front-end, the module defines a default refresh internal of 100 milliseconds.

If the refresh time interval is NULL, the display is refreshed each time one of the above methods are used.

Parameters:
itv - The display refresh interval.

setValue

FUNCTION setValue(value progress_dialog_value_type)

Sets the progressbar value without display refresh.

Parameters:
value - The value to be set in the progressbar.

setValueDisplayFormat

FUNCTION setValueDisplayFormat(fmt STRING)

Sets the format to show the current value at the end of the comment.

Parameters:
fmt - The USING format for the value, like "----&.&&"

show

FUNCTION show()

Displays current value in progress dialog window.

The method will not refresh the display, if the last call was done before the refresh interval has expired.

step

FUNCTION step() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Increments the progress value and refreshes display.

Only to be used when the limits are know, as a replacement for progress().

Returns:
TRUE if a new step could be done, FALSE if we reached the end.

stepInfinite

FUNCTION stepInfinite()

Increments the progress value in infinite mode and refreshes display.

Only to show progress when the limits are unknown (specified as NULL). This method can be called infinitely: The progress bar increments will be smaller and smaller, to never reach the end. Consider displaying execution time in the comment (withExecutionTime()) The display refresh is optimized: If this method is called many times in a loop, the progress value and the display refresh will be adapted, to avoid to much network roundtrips with the front-end.

 DEFINE p fglprogress.progress_dialog, x INTEGER
 ...
 CALL p.initialize("title","comment",NULL,NULL,NULL)
 CALL p.open()
 FOR x=1 TO 100000
     CALL p.stepInfinite()
 END FOR
 CALL p.close()

withConfirmation

FUNCTION withConfirmation(on BOOLEAN)

Sets the flag to get an OK button for confirmation when done.

Parameters:
on - TRUE = with OK button, FALSE = without.

withInterruption

FUNCTION withInterruption(on BOOLEAN)

Sets the flag to get a Cancel button to interrupt the process.

Parameters:
on - TRUE = with Cancel button, FALSE = without.

progress_dialog_value_type

TYPE progress_dialog_value_type DECIMAL(32,6)
